title: All lit up
body:
After having been open for four months, we finally FINALLY have lights on the front of the building. Now it actually looks like we're open! Thanks for your help putting them up, Dad!



Those lights, by the way, only cost me $30 a piece. I bought them from a farm equipment outlet store, where they're known as "barn lights." Despite their moniker, they look exactly like the lights everyone else has up downtown. Had I bought similar lights through a lighting store, they would've cost me $120+ a piece. Team Moxie scores again!
author: Dan

comments.author: --Jeff
comments.body: Looks awesome! I never really noticed the proscenium arch front until now.

comments.author: --Jeff
comments.body:
There's one of your t-shirt slogans!

The Masses want Moxie t-shirts!

comments.author: Laurali
comments.body: Fan-freakin-tastic! No longer will I drive up to the Moxie and have a moment where I fear you are closed for some reason. My weak heart thanks your dad for helping get those up!

comments.author: evilvet
comments.body: I guess you never saw the documentary, Farm Outlet Store:  The High Cost of Low Price, or you never would have purchased them there.

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body: Hey now maybe more people will start to Czech YOU Out instead.

comments.author: Aristocrat
comments.body: Now I can tell that the sidewalk is uneven!?!@#?  Am I the only one who thinks this looks (please do not hiss) cinematic?  Great pic, Dan!!!

comments.author: Trench
comments.body:
(re: barn lights)

Does this mean we can look forward to donkey shows at The Moxie?

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: Ah, Tijuana.  I remember thee well.

comments.author: Trench
comments.body: Chewy says The Moxie needs more donkey!

comments.author: Mark
comments.body:
So that's what the Moxie looks like now!

I not had realy had chance to post since last year (Happy dog year all!).

I'm v.happy that that the Moxie is ploughing along happily. I find the State of the Moxie post unaturaly interesting. Like looking at someone's bank account or something.

M

comments.author: Mark
comments.body:
Things I'd like from the Moxie in 06:

1) More Moxie t-shirts! You can sell them over the counter now as well as you loyal blog folks.
2) Sell movie magazines over the counter. I thought that was a great idea and is something I'd like at my local.
3) I wanna see the M.U.M.P.S. and R.A.S.H. stuff. Can you post some [SAMPLE] images?

I exchange I'll keep sending the Cornerhouse programs and the Moxie Shirt Adventure pics.

Deal?

M

comments.author: Maddy
comments.body: Isn't it funny how so many of us are obsessed with a movie theater we have never even seen or been to?

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Perhaps it doesn't even exist. Maybe I'm just really good at computer graphics.

comments.author: Trench
comments.body:
Intriguing.

You exist yet you don't?

Like Jesus' face on a tortilla?

Awesome.

I'll admit I have yet to come to a show... but it's totally because I'm a broke-ass mofo. And I hate money. And capitalism. And such and such. Start showing free-admission Commie Propoganda flicks at 3AM sunday night/monday morning and I'm totally there.

Or.

Find me a sugar-mama.

Both?

Like, whoa.

[I'm starting a movement: Open Source The Moxie! Bring freedom back! GPL my MTV! Okay, I'm done... that was sickening.]

[[Well, one more thing: TheMoxie.torrent pls]]

Omgosh I KID.

<3
